column2: The Associate Development Editor is responsible for developing assigned STM first editions and new editions for the higher education market, in both print and digital formats, to ensure projects meet the needs of their markets and publish on-time and within agreed-upon budgets                     Principal Accountabilities             Successful publishing and launching.    Deliver high-quality print STM products first editions and new editions; print and digial--that meet the needs of their markets and that publish on time and within agreed-upon budgets. Benchmark projects against leading competitors; do deep development editing of first editions for major markets; obtain reviews both for feedback and to seed potential adoptions; work with author, Editorial, Marketing and Sales to develop and hone unique selling points and a market-driven message. Develop digital expertise as needed for assigned projects and disciplines.           Deep development editing of first editions.    Via substantive briefs and targeted examples of manuscript editing, guide authors on textbook writing. Diagnose recurring writing issues and propose solutions via brief and sample edits. Help author develop pedagogical elements appropriate for the market; guide author in developing illustration program.               Project management.    Manage the development of assigned projects so that they are ready for efficient processing through Production. Work with author to establish manuscript development schedule, including writing, editing, and reviewing stages. Use effective persuasion with and motivation of authors to ensure they take market feedback and editing suggestions on board. Prepare detailed briefs for illustration programs. Attend to all other processes that fall within scope of development team such as permissions, design and cover briefs, initiating and developing online resources. Track and report on all aspects of projects through Press and team systems such as Centaur, reviewer logs, and Development team project files.            Discipline expertise.    Develop expertise in discipline-specific issues such as artwork, permissions, styling, online resources, market, and challenges in production. Serve as resource to Development colleagues working on projects in the discipline. Generate pipeline report and lead pipeline meetings in the discipline.                   Additional Duties             To carry out any other duties which may be reasonably expected of you by your immediate manager or a senior director.             (a)      Operating Environment:       Members of a collaborative team in India and Cambridge. Interact with a number of roles across the Academic team and the Press, and represent the Academic perspective       (b) Framework & Boundaries:       This role is subject to the Presss ethical framework and compliance procedures

column2: Education: Any Graduate              Experience: 3+ years                 Position Requirements:             Minimum of 3 years related medical/scientific editing experience, preferably in a large medical education and/or medical communications company, and/or professional medical publisher         Proven medical editing skills, with high level of attention to detail and experience in a broad variety of medical therapeutic areas         In-depth knowledge of medical/scientific phrasing, nuances, and terminology, including statistical concepts         Demonstrated understanding of editorial processes and procedures         Proficient in AMA style and experience with in-house styles         Familiarity with PubMed and similar sites to locate scientific publications         Above average expertise using PowerPoint masters, applying animations, and formatting slides according to pre-specified template         Efficient capabilities for developing and editing Word documents and performing image searches         Excellent time management and organizational skills, with the ability to efficiently coordinate and work on multiple tasks simultaneously in a highly deadline-driven environment, while taking into consideration global stakeholders based across multiple time zones         Ability and desire to meet deadlines and deliver results with minimum supervision by creatively using existing resources in a productive and/or innovative way, to quickly deal with unforeseen issues, and suggesting plausible solutions to ensure that timelines are consistently met         Self-motivated, possessing a positive attitude and very high energy, with a willingness to accept varied assignments         Exceptional focus on accuracy, attention to detail, and consistency of work, without being officious         Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills         Excellent computer software skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, SharePoint Online, Gmail)         Someone highly skilled in using all features of PowerPoint and Microsoft Word         Someone with strong team-building and interpersonal skills, and a cultural awareness to build    relationships with internationally recognized medical experts and colleagues         Preferred Qualifications:             Board-certified editor in the life science (BELS certification)             Experience editing independent medical education materials             Understanding of ACCME and/or EBAC and EACCME guidelines a plus             Experience editing non-native English writing             Experience with web-based document sharing sites (such as SharePoint Online)             Experience using web-based project management tools (such as WorkFront, ProofHQ, or MS Project)             Experience with ReadCube or other referencing software                           Role & Responsibilities:             Initiate production documents to include project features by adding appropriate sections and removing unnecessary ones         Develop and format PowerPoint slide decks that supplement live and online educational content         Generate tables and figures in PowerPoint from text-based educational content         Provide instruction to graphics editors to create complicated figure recreations and illustrations         Select images from our image database to augment educational content         Identify the need to and obtain permission from copyright holders to republish images         Perform quality control checks throughout the content development process to ensure completeness and consistency with product standards and requirements         Facilitate hand-off of material from editorial to web producers and manage the staging review process         Ensuring consistency and correctness in spelling, punctuation, grammar, syntax, and usage per AMA and Medscape house style; applying judicious substantive and clinical edits, as well as offering suggestions for improving clarity, format, and flow (all while upholding the authors voice)         Revising scientific language for usage, flow, and clarity, as well as ensuring facts, data, and scientific units have been used consistently         Formatting reference citations according to modified AMA style         Providing insight and guidance to other team members on editorial style, policies, and best practices         Maintaining friendly and productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders by clearly articulating with an effective communication style         Conveying edits and queries using a respectful tone and concise format         Continuously identifying opportunities for process improvement         Completing other responsibilities, as assigned

column2: We are seeking a passionate and experienced Fiction Book Editor to join our publishing team. The ideal candidate will have a deep appreciation for storytelling, a keen eye for detail, and a strong understanding of the publishing industry. As a Fiction Book Editor, you will collaborate with authors to refine their manuscripts, shape narratives, and ensure that each book meets our high standards of quality and marketability.      Responsibilities:          Manuscript Evaluation: Assess incoming manuscripts for their potential marketability, literary merit, and alignment with our publishing goals.          Developmental Editing: Work closely with authors to develop and refine their manuscripts, providing feedback on plot structure, character development, pacing, and overall storytelling.          Line Editing: Edit manuscripts for grammar, punctuation, style, and consistency while preserving the author's voice and vision.          Copyediting and Proofreading: Review manuscripts for spelling, grammar, and typographical errors, ensuring accuracy and adherence to publishing standards.          Collaborative Communication: Communicate effectively with authors, agents, and other members of the publishing team to ensure a smooth and collaborative editorial process.          Market Awareness: Stay informed about current trends in the publishing industry, including popular genres, emerging authors, and reader preferences.          Project Management: Manage multiple projects simultaneously, adhering to deadlines and ensuring timely delivery of edited manuscripts.          Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior editors and interns, fostering their professional growth and development.
column11: Author, Editor, Proof reading

column2: To see a book through from manuscript stage to handover, maintaining the highest quality editorial standards and ensuring it is error-free.         KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES              Editing & Proofing titles for the list:   Taking manuscripts from the structural edit stage to press   Liaising with authors through this process; working with authors to get permissions   Liaising with freelance editors & typesetters, indexers   Attending meetings and overseeing reprints   Tallying proofing corrections after they re incorporated in the file and sending error-free books to press   Coordinating with authors, typesetters and freelancers regarding the respective timeframes for projects   Circulating specifications for projects and handing over the text to press   Managing Freelancers:   Managing the payments and budgets for freelancers     Working on the metadata, including B3 entry, for projects   Raising POs for projects and getting invoices processed                  ROLE REQUIREMENTS         Experienced copy editor with an eye for detail   Exceptional organizational and project management skills   A pro-active communicator who is also prompt

column2: The Brand and Creative Agency team is part of the Marketing COE in Bangalore     This team produces primarily print and some digital collateral for our 145+ brand partners     The Jr Proofreader is responsible for ensuring error-free deliverables and quality at various stages of the creation and production process within the Brand Creative Agency     This role requires a detail-oriented person who is well-versed in the English language and its nuances     The Jr Proofreader ensures that all jobs done by the Bangalore Brand Creative Agency will be entirely free of errors, including language, brand voice and tone, grammar, and technical issues, and produced at the highest-quality level     The Jr Proofreader supports internal communications work and single client-facing communications, and provides support to the Sr     Proofreader on larger initiatives and projects, as needed           Job Description             Proof reading/quality check:     Reviews content and final production files from a brand, language, tone and grammatical aspect. Displays deep understanding of brand guidelines and ability to maintain consistency in tone and language across different communication materials over time. Has a keen eye for detail and focus on quality regardless of medium, focusing on internal or customer-facing card communications. Applies knowledge of Microsoft Office tools such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams to execute daily work.                     Team development:     Collaborates with other team members effectively, ensuring good communication between roles in order to support the work. Coordinates with the US Brand Creative Agency to provide support when needed.                     Project management:      Provides revisions on working files and final files as required. Manages multiple projects against tight deadlines demonstrating the ability to multi-tasking, prioritize, and utilize excellent attention to detail. Exhibits outstanding verbal and written communication skills when working with internal partners.                     Minimum Qualifications:           Bachelor s Degree         Two or more years of professional work experience in a marketing, advertising, or communications-related field or equivalent.                   Preferred Experience:           Bachelor s Degree in Marketing, related field         Two or more years of professional work experience in a marketing, advertising, or communications-related field or equivalent. Proven demonstration of handling high volume projects.

column2: Project Role : Translator Project Role Description : Provide technical translation services for technology programs and projects.  Must have skills : German Good to have skills : customer satisfaction Minimum  3  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : 15 yrs of minimum full time education Summary :As a Translator, you will be responsible for providing technical translation services for technology programs and projects. Your typical day will involve translating technical documents from German to English and vice versa, ensuring accuracy and clarity of the content.  Roles & Responsibilities: Translate technical documents from German to English and vice versa, ensuring accuracy and clarity of the content. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure consistency and accuracy of technical terminology across all documents. Review and edit translated documents for grammar, spelling, and punctuation errors. Ensure adherence to project timelines and quality standards for all translated documents. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Fluency in German. Good To Have Skills:Proficiency in English. Strong understanding of technical terminology and concepts in both German and English. Experience in translating technical documents, including user manuals, product specifications, and technical reports. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both German and English. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in technical translation services. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in German language or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering high-quality technical translations. This position is based at our Bengaluru office.

column2: OVERVIEW: Guidepoint Insights enables clients to make better-informed decisions through well-researched and skillfully moderated teleconferences, in-person events, and its teleconference transcript library. Comprised of former investment professionals and sell-side equity research analysts, the content generated from the Insights Team features experts from Guidepoints proprietary global network and covers a wide range of topics to facilitate investment research. We are looking to add an experienced Digital Copy Editor to join our team. Guided by superior proofreading skills, sharp editorial judgment, keen technical awareness, and digital savvy, this person would help manage and maintain the companys growing digital library of teleconferences by ensuring that all supporting text reflects Guidepoints standards for quality and accuracy. Job Title - Digital Copy Editor Location - Mumbai - Hybrid - BKC Job Type - Full Time - Permanent WHAT YOULL DO: Oversee the day-to-day digital properties and content strategies for the team as the final quality check while exercising outstanding editorial judgment to guarantee timely, high-quality output across web copy and other client-facing materials Copyedit supporting teleconference media, reviewing and proofreading text for consistency, accuracy, and clarity based on AP style and/or AMA style, in-house style, and fundamental grammatical standards Support the digital librarys functionality and drive cataloging precision by leveraging organic SEO best practices in conjunction with in-house strategy Communicate across departments to maintain fluid workflows, ensuring all deadlines are met Contribute to developing editorial initiatives, engaging in creative problem-solving with fellow digital editors WHAT YOU HAVE: Bachelors degree in English, Journalism, or a related discipline 3+ years of copy editing and/or digital media experience, preferably in a business- or industry-focused content Working knowledge of AP and AMA writing styles; experience leveraging these in conjunction with in-house guidelines Digital media editing or writing experience, including familiarity with SEO best practices Computer skills including but not limited to Microsoft Office or equivalent suites, CRM and/or CMS systems, and business communication and collaboration platforms Proven ability to excel in fast-paced, deadline-driven environments and deliver on tight deadlines without sacrificing work quality, whether collaborating or working independently Meticulous attention to detail, solid organizational skills, and flexibility while multitasking Excellent verbal and communication skills Confidence to diplomatically communicate with key stakeholders and receive constructive criticism with an optimistic disposition A positive attitude Work samples prepared to provide upon request WHAT WE OFFER: Competitive compensation Employee medical coverage Central office location Entrepreneurial environment, autonomy, and fast decisions Casual work environment ABOUT GUIDEPOINT: Guidepoint is a leading research enablement platform designed to advance understanding and empower our clients decision-making process. Powered by innovative technology, real-time data, and hard-to-source expertise, we help our clients to turn answers into action. Backed by a network of nearly 1.5 million experts, and Guidepoint?? 1,300 employees worldwide we inform leading organizations??research by delivering on-demand intelligence and research on request. With Guidepoint, companies and investors can better navigate the abundance of information available today, making it both more useful and more powerful.

column2: Pre-editing is the processwhereby a human prepares a document before applying machine translation. Well-versed in the stylemanuals: APA, AMA, CMS, and MLA (or) an equivalent style manual. Strong in English grammar, especially in subjectverbagreement.     Flexible to work in rotational shift. column2: The Associate Editor will be part of an international team of experienced reporters covering global thermal coal markets     The position will be based in Gurgaon, India     The job includes gathering primary market intelligence directly from industry sources and producing news articles and in-depth analysis stories     Besides doing extensive price reporting, you will be expected to connect the dots on key themes affecting the sector, and to produce timely, high-quality news as well as embark on commodity benchmark price building activities     The role also involves seeking out opportunities for cross-commodity collaboration with teams of competing fuels like LNG or other commodity sectors                 The Impact:              This is a key role with Platts continuing to cement its role as the global leader in thermal coal pricing, building strong benchmark price as well as valuable news content.             Your Skills:              A natural team worker with excellent written and verbal communication skills, you have a proven journalistic track record and a strong news sense.          You should also have exceptional energy, tenacity and ambition to excel in a fast-paced environment.             Responsibilities:               Writing daily market comments, news, regular in-depth analytical articles, and price assessment formation processes within the Asia-Pacific, US and the EMEA thermal coal teams           Develop and maintain productive relationships with a broad base of key industry sources in coal         Research and interpret market issues         Develop proposals around new pricing assessments or changes          Understand relevance of information to the customer, and facilitate the development of value-added news/information         Ensure copy and commentary is accurate, aligning with pricing data and assessments         Contribute to team source development strategy for coal         Regularly represent Platts at industry events and functions with a view to eventually fulfilling public speaking/expert panel engagements                 Qualifications:               Degree in journalism or business preferred           Experience of commodities      reporting/writing/analysis     would be a distinct advantage         Strong      editing/proof-reading     skills         Strong interpersonal and communication skills that implement good listening, a clear writing style and strong verbal skills. The ability to communicate across a wide range of groups and personalities internally and externally         Displays strong numeracy including a solid understanding of economics principles and of risk management principles         Strong critical thinking skills         Strong time management skills and willingness to work with teams across regions at their timezones.
column11: Supply chain, Analytical, Market intelligence, Coal, thermal, Risk management, Associate Editor, Analytics, Automotive

column2: Evaluate content as a partner to external editors,      iteratively improve on the editorial process for editors and reviewers,      engage closely with authors to help them improve their manuscripts,      help authors increase their odds of success to be published in another journal if rejected from their first choice.      Content evaluation is based on questions such as: is the article submitted within the aims and scope of the journal(s); does the science make sense; do the results support the main conclusions; have the authors chosen an appropriate method; is the manuscript of sufficient quality; Is this the right journal for this work, or could the authors improve their manuscript to increase their odds of success at another journal      Our Editors offer authors guidance and ensure a smooth overall experience for authors who submit to our journals.      Roles in our team are located at any one of our global locations, primarily: Oxford, Amsterdam, Chennai, Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, Beijing, Shanghai and Shenzhen.              What you should bring:            PhD in Physical Sciences discipline(s)        An experimental, results-driven, and enthusiastic work attitude      Record of having published papers in scientific journals      Technology savvy, familiar with online platforms, social media and digital content      Good communication skills and excellent written and spoken English      Relationship builder and self-starter; ability to build relationships both within the scientific community as well as within Elsevier on different levels within a large international environment      Broad scientific interest and desire to serve and help customers

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES  This is a full-time onsite position with the primary responsibilities of providing accurate proofing and editing of assigned materials. The position requires a 4-year college degree (or equivalent), preferably a bachelors degree in English, journalism or related field of study; 1-3 years of experience in copy editing, proofreading or in a related area; proficiency in PowerPoint and Microsoft software; a high level of skill in written English, including spelling, grammar and punctuation; and excellent organizational and interpersonal skills. Furthermore, the position requires continual attention to detail and the ability to establish priorities to meet deadlines.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:    Proof and edit all assigned materials for clarity and consistency of content, correct spelling, grammar, punctuation and typographical errors utilizing SAI-Med Partners standardization Rewrite parts of text as necessary and query authors when unsure of content and/or meaning Handle multiple projects, paying close attention to priority and tight deadlines Non-essential Duties and Responsibilities:   Other duties as assigned Physical Demands / Work Conditions:   Employee must be able to sit for extended periods of time Employee must have the ability to stay focused throughout an entire document, which may be long and technical Employee must be able to talk and hear to easily communicate with authors of assigned materials Employee routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, scanners, etc., and must use hands and fingers to operate the equipment/controls and is occasionally required to walk  Employee must work in a fast-paced environment, sometimes resulting in stressful situations Time pressures and tight deadlines may require the employee to work overtime.   Warm Regards Isha Shrivastava Sr. Consultant isha_shrivastava@persolkelly.com www.persolkelly.co.in Sriram Samanthu Chambers, #3287, 12th Main, Indiranagar, Bangalore 560038, India ********** CONFIDENTIAL NOTE: The information contained in this e-mail and any accompanying documents may contain information that is confidential or otherwise protected from disclosure. column2: JD for Copy Editor role Responsibility: The editor is responsible for editing assigned projects within tight deadlines and to the highest quality standards. Specific tasks include, but are not limited to:  Editing original content that is published globally on our leading healthcare professional education site along with other materials, including text, images, and graphics Ensuring consistency and correctness in spelling, punctuation, grammar, syntax, and usage per AMA and Medscape house style; applying judicious substantive edits, as well as offering suggestions for improving clarity, format, and flow (all while upholding the author's voice) Revising scientific language for usage, flow, and clarity, as well as ensuring facts, data, and scientific units have been used consistently Formatting reference citations according to the modified AMA style Fact-checking and conducting other quality control reviews Proofreading print collateral and web pages Providing insight and guidance to other team members on editorial style, policies, and best practices stakeholders by clearly articulating with an effective communication style Conveying edits and queries using a respectful tone and concise format Continuously identifying opportunities for process improvement Completing other responsibilities, as assigned  The Editor must have: Have a solid editorial background in multiple medical therapeutic areas and in the healthcare industry. Be someone whos comfortable editing in Microsoft Word using track changes, MS Excel as well as in PowerPoint (Office 365) Possess a positive attitude, friendly query style, and who knows how to prioritize multiple deadlines in a high-volume environment and return work on time (and how to proactively assess and inform other stakeholders of any delays) Enjoy the opportunity to write and wordsmith, as needed Obtain satisfaction in the accuracy and consistency of your work Be a true team player who jumps in and tackles new assignments and looks for ways to help assist colleagues in the department Be comfortable in a highly deadline-driven environment, and able to pivot quickly between tasks and adapt to rapidly shifting priorities Enjoy leveraging technology to make your job easier  Qualifications: Bachelor or Masters degree in life science, English, or journalism, or equivalent work experience Minimum of 3 years related medical/scientific editing experience, preferably in a large medical education and/or medical communications company, and/or professional medical publisher Proven medical editing skills, with a high level of attention to detail and experience in a broad variety of medical therapeutic areas In-depth knowledge of medical/scientific phrasing, nuances, and terminology, including statistical concepts Experience with internet technologies and online/electronic editing Demonstrated understanding of editorial processes and procedures Excellent time management and organizational skills, with the ability to efficiently coordinate and work on multiple tasks simultaneously in a highly deadline-driven environment, while taking into consideration global stakeholders based across multiple time zones Ability and desire to meet deadlines and deliver results with minimum supervision by creatively using existing resources in a productive and/or innovative way, to quickly deal with unforeseen issues, and suggesting plausible solutions to ensure that timelines are consistently met Self-motivated, possessing a positive attitude and very high energy, with a willingness to accept varied assignments Exceptional focus on accuracy, attention to detail, and consistency of work, without being officious Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills Excellent computer software skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Gmail)  Excellent knowledge of the  Chicago manual of style  and  Vancouver style Preferred Qualifications Experience editing independent medical education materials and Journals Experience editing non-native English writing Experience using web-based project management tools (such as Zoho or MS Project) Experience with ReadCube or other referencing software

column2: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.             Main Duties:           Perform translations (EN - HI) in one or more translation tools     Translate various types of content, eg marketing, help, UI, or regulated content     Support the team with copy-edit tasks on selected content types     Master the standard CAT tools and tools associated with translation work for internal clients (eg tools for creating queries or checking the live UI elements)     Precisely follow the established translation process, eg always raise queries when there is a need to     Precisely follow the style guide and overall client requirements     Improve based on the corrections made by senior team members as well as the client reviewers     Keep track of personal error statistics and work on the weak spots     Take part in the internal training and the ones organized by the client     Participate in the error arbitration process     Meet the productivity KPIs     Take part in the internal quality meetings and the quality calls organized by the client for the whole team     Constantly analyze your own gaps and think of what assistance the senior members can provide to help address them.           REQUIREMENTS         University degree in Translation/Applied Languages     6 months of experience in translation     Fluent in English (both written and spoken, in a wide range of registers)     Native fluency in the target language      Experience in creating easy-to-read texts     Passion for the world of Language and technology.

column2: This is a unique opportunity to be part of the content production team within RA Studio which focuses on producing quality content for conference presentations and relevant research documents      We are looking for an individual with good communication skills and ability to work within stringent timelines      This is a great opportunity for a multi-tasker who can collaborate well with different teams and stakeholders                  What you will do:              Edit report, conference presentations and time-sensitive deliverables.      Make changes to content (typically in Google s Content Production Platform [CPP] and PowerPoint).      Identify and raise queries regarding incomplete or incorrect information related to statistics or chart in the document to ensure quality output.      Responsible for daily proofreading of the assigned reports and research documents prior to the publishing process and recommend changes to edited materials in Google docs, using suggestions and comments features to ensure timely capture of the recommendations for action.      Adhere to Gartner s in-house Style Guide and Lexicon throughout the editing and proofreading process to verify details like company name spellings, product names etc and ensuring publishing of the documents as per Gartner policy and process.      Provide feedback to the Global Editing team to help enhancing the quality of the documents.      Demonstrate ownership of the assigned projects or tasks and share best practices with the team ensure quality output.              What you will need:          Master s/Bachelor s degree in English, Journalism, Liberal Arts or in relevant discipline.      0 to 4 years of editorial experience with exposure to quality checking/proofreading, preferably working for newspapers, magazines, or journals in the field of IT research.      Ability to work in a fast-paced environment managing stringent timelines.      Excellent written and verbal communication skills.      Attention to detail      Knowledge of AP Style guide would be an added advantage.      Working knowledge of Word, PowerPoint, Excel and g-suite      Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with others and provide sound recommendations.      Excellent English language skills in editing and writing.      Problem-solving mindset and willingness to take own initiatives while mitigating risks.      Ability to understand and quickly adapt to new processes, best practices, and changes to style.      Problem-solving mindset and willingness to take own initiatives while mitigating risks.              What you will get:            In addition to an outstanding work environment with advancement potential, Gartner associates enjoy exceptional compensation and benefits, including:        Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and more!      Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.      Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities.      Ability to understand and quickly adapt to new processes, best practices and changes to style.          Collaborative attitude and no-limits learning mindset.      Great team player.
column11: Interpersonal skills, Publishing, HR, Medical insurance, Research, Powerpoint, Associate Editor, Proof reading, Recruitment

column2: Own the written word, ensure all content is well-written, standardized, edited and formatted correctly      Ensure design and layout inconsistencies are also spotted.      Ensure writing style is in line with the tone and tenor required by clients and implement internal or client specified style sheet on documents.      Carry out live document standardization, spell-checks and other hygiene tests directly on designed documents, be it in PowerPoint or PDF formats.      Use contemporary technology tools to make the workflow robust      Train business writers, copywriters and other team members on fundamentals            Requirements      Excellent knowledge of English punctuation and grammar; ability to switch between British and American English      Detail orientation bordering on OCD      Experience with building stylesheets and word templates for error free, standardized writing      Familiarity with an Indian language is desirable      Tech-savvy and knowledge of proofreading software and online tools is an added advantage      Exposure to corporate communications, annual reports, equity research reports is highly desirable      Knowledge of global and country specific conventions is a definite plus      Ability to create best practices related to writing and editing, train colleagues and create a culture of grammatical accuracy            Benefits      Opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial, multi-disciplinary consultancy for top-notch clients, producing    business-critical communication      Award-winning global office with ample space for social distancing.      Unique service proposition ensures interesting, mature work that has long-term impact.      Contributing to an organization that has shaped change, and led through intelligence and insight      Growing portfolio of international clients      Best-in-class compensation structure with attractive, performance-linked variable pay and other benefits.      Empowered, informal, flexible, and fun environment that rewards initiative and values ambition      Significant learning and career progression opportunities      Medical and Accidental Insurance Coverage            Qualification and Experience:          Excellent communication skills both written and verbal      Experience of working in organizations such as consulting firms, equity research outfits, investment banks, printing establishments and content companies will be preferred.      Must be comfortable with reading on screen as well as in print      Familiarity with numbers, basic financial concepts and statutory information      Graduate or postgraduates in any discipline, preferably in English

column2: Create high-quality, engaging, and informative content in Hindi for civil services aspirants.             Translate content from English to Hindi and vice versa, ensuring accuracy and maintaining the original context.             Proofread and edit content to eliminate errors in grammar, spelling, and punctuation.             Collaborate with the team to develop content strategies and concepts for UPSC mains and interview preparations.             Stay updated on the latest trends and topics in the civil services field and incorporate them into the content.             Manage and schedule content on social media platforms to engage with our audience effectively.             Utilize your knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentation creation.                 Qualifications:             Bachelors degree in a relevant field.             Proficiency in Hindi with excellent writing, translation, and proofreading skills.             Prior work experience in content writing, translation, or proofreading is a plus.             Knowledge of civil services and having written UPSC mains and/or attended an interview is highly desirable.             Familiarity with social media platforms and digital marketing strategies.             Basic computing skills and the ability to work with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.                         ?

column2: 1. Context    Hindi Translator        2. Organogram    Assistant/Manager Content & Curriculum      |        3. Key Objectives of the Job          To create error free translation in Hindi which will be easily understood while maintaining the key essence.          To understand the organizational and the stakeholders need and translate the documents in Hindi meticulously while picking up gaps/mistakes while proof reading and editing the document.          4. Major Deliverables    The major responsibilities are :        To translate documents in Hindi and be consistent in the language, vocabulary and style used in alignment to Arpan standards and maintain the quality of the work.          To work with the Senior Translator and support them in translation, proof reading and transcreation of various modules, manuals, documents and M&E tools.          To translate the content from Hindi to English.          To be able to effectively plan and prioritize their work to ensure the documents are delivered on timely manner.          To maintain the time sheet and submit on time.          5. Job Challenge          To be able to translate and /or transcreate documents without losing its essence.          To have an eye for details while translating, reviewing, proof reading, documenting and systematically maintaining the documents.          Work under pressure while adhering to the timelines.          To work with complete ownership.          6. Specialized job competencies          Strong understanding of Hindi and English language (written and spoken).          Strong grammatical skills.          Should be able to understand, edit and proofread documents and translate/ transcreate the same in Hindi.          Demonstrate skills in translating, proofreading and editing lengthy documents.          7. Educational Qualification    Post-Graduation in Hindi Literature or any other translation/transcreation related course    8. Desired Experience          Experienced in translation/transcreation documents from English into Hindi and vice versa.          Prior experience of editing and proofreading lengthy document.          Experienced in writing content and curriculum module on life skill, psychology, or social issues related to children will be an added advantage.          9. Other desired attributes            Ability to work independently, in teams; inter-personal skills; commitment to time schedules, meticulous in day to day work passionate and good organizational skills.      Should be a stickler for detail and process adherence.
